result.execSummary:
The defendant Otis L. Johnson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Review Hearing on 11/15/16 @ 8:30am to see if deft has obtained c/s orders for all three of his children.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action for all 3 children w/n 6 months.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review Hrg on 11/15/16 @ 8:30am to see if deft has obtained c/s orders for all three of his children.  Report to P&P office from court to submit UA.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpd financial obligations are still to be collected.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  (DOC-2156)  Def. has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of confinement time not served will be added to extended supervision time.  Total length of sentence will not be changed.  DOC shall determine the number of days converted from confinement to extended supervision based on actual release date.
Re:  Completion of CIP.

PSI Credit

Deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.  *No contact with Noah.
